intro: Microstylis merapiensis, commonly known as the Merapi slender sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the tropical regions of Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Microstylis merapiensis typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various insect and bird species.
